The integration takes place over the rectangle shown below.

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [-1, {#ymax#}, {#xmax#}, -1], keepaspectratio: true, axis: true, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false, grid: false }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on x-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.x.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, // hide numbers majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'x', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [1, -10] } }); // Hide tick labels and ticks on y-axis but label it board.defaultAxes.y.setAttribute({ ticks: { drawLabels: false, majorHeight: 0, minorHeight: 0 }, name: 'y', withLabel: true, label: { position: 'rt', offset: [-15, 0] } }); // points var bl = board.create('point', [0,0], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var br = board.create('point', [{#aa#},0], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}) var tr = board.create('point', [{#aa#},{#bb#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var tl = board.create('point', [0,{#bb#}], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: true, showInfobox: false, size: 3, face: 'o', fillColor: 'black', strokeColor: 'black'}); var rectangle = board.create('polygon', [bl, br, tr, tl],{name:"Rectangle",withLabel:false, color: 'white'}); // Set all edges (borders) to black rectangle.borders.forEach(line => { line.setAttribute({strokeColor: 'darkblue'}); }); // Label coordinates dynamically [bl, br, tr, tl].forEach((pt) => { board.create('text', [ () => pt.X() + 0.1, () => pt.Y() + 0.1, () => `(${pt.X()}, ${pt.Y()})` ], { fontSize: 12, fixed: true, highlight: false }); }); [[/jsxgraph]]

We have
\(\qquad \displaystyle\int_{x=0}^{@aa@}\displaystyle\int_{y=0}^{@bb@}xy \, \mathrm{d}y\mathrm{d}x\)

Evaluating the inner integral, we get
\(\qquad\displaystyle\int_{y=0}^{@bb@} xy\, \mathrm{d}y\)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = \left[\dfrac{xy^2}{2}\right]_{y=0}^{@bb@} \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = \dfrac{{@(bb)^2@}x}{2} - \dfrac{(0)^2x}{2} \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = {@((bb)^2*x)/2@} \)

This can then be put into the outer integral to give
\(\qquad \displaystyle\int_{x=0}^{@aa@} {@((bb)^2*x)/2@} \, \mathrm{d}x\)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = \left[\dfrac{1}{2} \times {@((bb)^2*x^2/2)@} \right]_{x=0}^{@aa@} \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = \left[{@(1/2)*(((bb)^2*x^2)/2)@} \right]_{x=0}^{@aa@} \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = {@(1/2)*(((bb)^2*(aa)^2)/2)@} - {@(1/2)*(((bb)^2*0^2)/2)@} \)

\(\qquad \displaystyle = {@(1/2)*(((bb)^2*(aa)^2)/2) - (1/2)*(((bb)^2*0^2)/2)@} \)
